data.title: Nas and Kelis - The WAGs of These Rappers Are Outshining Their Partners
data.meta_description: Widely regarded as one of the greatest rappers of all time, Nas also had one of the most highly publicized, tumultuous relationships in the world of rap. …
data.text:
Kendrick Lamar and Whitney Alford

Patience is often rewarded, and Kendrick Lamar and his girlfriend, Whitney Alford, embody this adage. Having been high school sweethearts, their enduring love story has withstood the test of time and continues to inspire others. Their commitment to each other is a testament to the power of true love.

Their bond has only grown stronger with the arrival of their child, adding a new chapter to their story. Despite Kendrick's meteoric rise to fame and success, he has prioritized keeping his personal life private. This demonstrates his deep respect for the relationship he shares with Whitney, valuing their connection above the allure of public attention.

Anderson .Paak and Jaylin

Anderson .Paak met his wife, Jaylin, while studying at the Musicians Institute of Hollywood. Jaylin was also a music student at the time, and the two bonded over their shared passion. After years of dating, the couple tied the knot in 2011 and have been going strong ever since.

Jaylin is a supportive partner to Anderson, attending most of his shows and always holding his hand at every awards ceremony. The couple has two children together and has been known to keep their family life private while still showing love for each other in public. Sounds just like Paak.

Kanye West and Bianca Censori

Kanye West has certainly been through the ringer over the last few years, for many reasons. The "College Dropout" rapper/producer got into arguably one of the most high-profile relationships in the history of pop culture when he tied the knot with Kim Kardashian. As time went on, fame, mental health problems, and political differences drew a wedge between the two.

They have since gone their separate ways and it has been reported that Ye informally married Bianca Censori, an architect from Australia, who also works for West's brand Yeezy. However, their marriage has been deemed illegitimate as they never filed for a marriage license.

A$AP Rocky and Rihanna

A$AP Rocky and Rihanna's love story began as a close friendship that evolved into romance. The pair kept fans on their toes about their relationship status until their 2019 red-carpet debut at the Fashion Awards ignited dating rumors. Although they were only friends at the time, by November 2020, People magazine confirmed they were a couple.

Fans were delighted by their surprise pregnancy announcement in January 2022, and the couple welcomed their first child in May of that year. She announced her second pregnancy shortly after, during her Superbowl Halftime show in February 2023. A$AP Rocky and Rihanna's journey from friends to partners and parents is a heartwarming testament to the power of friendship as the foundation for a lasting love story.

Flo Rida and Eva Marcille

With seven studio albums to his name, Flo Rida has sold over 100 million records worldwide. And things seem to be going well for him in the love department as well. Flo Rida is currently in a long-term relationship with Eva Marcille, a beautiful model and actress. The couple has been dating since 2018 and have a son together named Maverick.

In addition to his music career, Flo Rida has also made appearances on television shows and movies. While the rapper has been linked to several women in the past, he has never been married, but Eva seems to be the reigning queen and the one who’s there to stay.

E-40 and Tracey Stevens

E-40, the old-school rapper, has been happily married to his sweetheart Tracey Stevens for more than three decades now. The duo first met in high school, and sparks flew between them. Fast forward to today, and they are still madly in love.

According to E-40, the secret to their long-lasting relationship is communication and shared interests. He also gave credit to his wife for keeping him out of trouble. Throughout their 30+ years together, E-40 and Tracey have built a beautiful family with two kids. It just goes to show that true love can withstand the test of time if you just work on it.

Kokane and Alicia Long

Jerry B. Long Jr., known professionally as Kokane, is an American rapper, singer, and record producer from California. With a career spanning over three decades, Kokane has collaborated with some of the biggest names in hip-hop, including Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, and Ice Cube.

When he's not making music, Kokane enjoys spending time with his wife, Alicia Long. The two have been together for over 20 years and have a strong bond, with Kokane calling Alicia his rock and inspiration. “Alicia never misses a show,” says the rapper. Together, they have eight children and continue to prioritize their family and love for each other.

The Kid Laroi and Katarina Deme

The Kid Laroi's success story is not just about his talent, but also about his love life. The Australian pop sensation's rise to fame was greatly influenced by his relationship with young rapper and Instagram influencer Katarina Deme. Despite spending most of their time apart and only communicating online, their love for each other remained strong.

When they finally reunited, their bond proved unbreakable, and their love continues to grow stronger. It's heartwarming to see that The Kid Laroi's love life has played a crucial role in his success, and we can only hope that their relationship will continue to thrive.

Yelawolf and Fefe Dobson

Alabama native Yelawolf is an American rapper and hip-hop artist with a loyal following of numerous fans. He's known for his unique sound and lyrical skills, and he’s been climbing the success ladder since 2005. But when it comes to his personal life, Yelawolf is all about his talented wife — Canadian singer and songwriter Fefe Dobson.

With her own impressive career, Fefe has been in the music industry since she was a teenager, and seems to be the perfect match for Yelawolf. Since tying the knot in 2019, the singers have always been together. Whether on cute social media posts, red carpet events, or award ceremonies, these two always have each other’s backs.

G-Eazy and Jenaye Noah

G-Eazy is an American rapper and producer with a successful music career. He's known for his hit songs like "Me, Myself & I" and "No Limit", and he seems to be climbing the hip-hop success ladder slowly but surely. But let's talk about his other half — the stunning model and fashion designer Jenaye Noah. They started dating at the beginning of 2023, and it seems the gorgeous Jenaye is the perfect match for G-Eazy.

The couple have been spotted at fashion events and parties, getting cozy with each other. We don’t know how long these lovebirds will last, but they seem to be quite crazy about each other. Wether they're dropping beats or walking the runway, G-Eazy and Jenaye are always on top of their game.

Professor Green and Karima McAdams

British rapper Professor Green has been a longtime advocate for mental health awareness, and he found an equally passionate partner in actress and model Karima McAdams in 2019. Karima is not only a successful artist and actor, but also a martial arts enthusiast and the face of the Lara Croft character in the popular video game franchise.

Since getting together, the power couple has been a force for good, using their platforms to raise awareness about the importance of mental health and advocating for those struggling with it. With their shared passion and commitment to the cause, Professor Green and Karima are an inspiration to many.

Swizz Beatz and Alicia Keys

Swizz Beatz and Alicia Keys first met as teenagers but didn't start a romantic relationship until 2008. However, the start of their relationship was rocky as Beatz was involved with someone else at the time. In fact, he was still married to his first wife and had a son with her.

His ex-wife accused Keys of destroying their family, and the drama continued when Beatz had an additional relationship with Jahna Sebastian and found out she was pregnant with his child. Despite all this drama, Keys stood by his side. The two got engaged in May 2010 and married two months later. They now have two children together.

DJ Khaled and Nicole Tuck

DJ Khaled and Nicole Tuck have been together for over a decade and have been through many ups and downs together. Despite their busy schedules, they always make time for each other and their family. Khaled has even referred to Tuck as his "queen" and "rock" in multiple interviews, showing the world just how much he values their relationship.

Their love story is a true inspiration and a reminder that with hard work and dedication, anything is possible. And if you need any further proof, just head over to any of their social media accounts, they’re just too adorable for words.

Papoose and Remy Ma

Papoose and Remy Ma have been going strong for over a decade, with a story that is full of twists and turns. The couple met through a mutual friend and Papoose was immediately smitten with Remy's fierce talent and beauty. However, they kept their relationship under wraps for years until Papoose proposed to Remy during her legal woes.

The couple had a tough time, with Remy behind bars, and a botched wedding attempt. However, their love persevered, and they eventually tied the knot and started a family. Although they went through a heartbreaking incomplete pregnancy, they were blessed with the birth of their daughter, Reminisce Mackenzie.

Macklemore and Tricia Davis

Tricia Davis is the rock behind her husband, rapper Macklemore. The two first connected on MySpace in 2006, and Tricia went against her family to be with the love of her life. Their relationship has seen some rough patches, including Macklemore's relapses in 2008, 2011, and 2018.

But through it all, Tricia has stood by her husband's side and helped him overcome his struggles. The couple has been married since 2015 and managed to stay afloat during the pandemic. They have three children together, and Tricia continues to support her husband's music career while also being a mother and homemaker.

RZA and Talani Rabb

RZA, the multi-talented Wu-Tang Clan member, has been in a steady and loving relationship with Talani Rabb for quite some time now. Although the couple keeps their personal life private, RZA has spoken fondly about his leading lady, describing her as his "rock" and an inspiration for his music.

Talani even lent her smooth vocals to RZA's 2018 album "Birth of a Prince," proving that they not only make a great couple but also great collaborators. It's always heartwarming to see two people who support each other and grow together. Together, RZA and Talani have had one kid together, while the former has had eight other kids from past relationships.

Krizz Kaliko and Crystal Watson

Krizz Kaliko, born Samuel Watson, is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter from Kansas City, Missouri. He is known for his unique style that blends elements of hip-hop, rock, and funk. With a successful career spanning over two decades, Krizz Kaliko has collaborated with many prominent artists, including Tech N9ne, Eminem, and T-Pain.

In addition to his music, Krizz Kaliko is also a devoted husband to his wife, Crystal Watson. The couple has been together for several years and have two children together. Crystal is often seen supporting her husband at his shows and events, and even after all these years, they are still clearly crazy about each other.

John Legend and Chrissy Teigen

John Legend and Chrissy Teigen are a beloved celebrity couple known for their music, modeling, and TV-hosting careers. They met in 2007, married in 2013, and have been open about their struggles with infertility and the loss of their unborn son.

Despite it all, they remain a united and supportive couple, raising their two children Luna and Miles. From fun social media posts to heartfelt interviews, they inspire fans with their love and resilience. John Legend and Chrissy Teigen are proof of what true love looks like, and their love story is one for the ages. In fact, it seems life smiled at these two with two more children, and their social media photos will melt your heart.

Mustard and Chanel Dijon

Mustard, born Dijon McFarlane, is a Grammy-winning rapper and producer from Los Angeles. He is known for creating some of the biggest hits in hip-hop, including collaborations with artists like Ella Mai, Tyga and Migos. And his love life has also been a success – having been with his longtime girlfriend, Chanel Dijon, for over two decades.

Mustard and Chanel Dijon have been one of hip-hop's strongest couples since they met when they were teenagers. In October 2018, the rapper sealed his fate with an unforgettable proposal to her. Two years later, the lovebirds got married in a beautiful intimate ceremony. The rapper and his model and social media influencer wife now have three beautiful kids.

Ace Hood and Shelah Marie

Ace Hood is a talented American rapper who has been making waves in the hip-hop industry for over a decade. With hits like "Bugatti" and "Hustle Hard," Ace Hood has cemented his place as one of the most respected and successful rappers in the game. But when he's not spitting fire in the booth, Ace Hood enjoys spending time with his wife, Shelah Marie.

The two have been together for several years and are often seen on social media sharing their love and affection. With her own successful career as a yoga instructor and wellness advocate, Shelah keeps Ace grounded and focused on his music. It's clear that Ace Hood and Shelah Marie are a match made in hip-hop heaven.

Biggie and Faith Evans

Biggie Smalls, also known as the Notorious B.I.G., may have left us too soon, but his undeniable charm and charisma were evident every time he performed. A true musical talent like no other, he seemed to also have a knack for choosing a great woman — his equally talented and beautiful wife, Faith Evans.

Their love story began when they met shortly before their wedding day. Eight days after their first encounter, they said their vows and became hip-hop royalty. Though they technically separated prior to his passing, the bond between Biggie and Faith was truly magical and transcended this world. Even after Biggie's untimely passing, their love continued to inspire fans everywhere.

Chance the Rapper and Kristen Corley

Chance the Rapper has been happily married to his childhood sweetheart, Kristen Corley, since 2019. The two first met when they were just nine years old and later reconnected in 2013. After a few years of dating, Chance proposed to Kristen at a Fourth of July party in 2018.

The two tied the knot the following year in a beautiful ceremony in Newport Beach, California. The couple shares two daughters, Kensli and Marli. Kristen is a successful businesswoman and former athlete, having founded the children's clothing brand World of BOBY. She is also a model and a former basketball player.

Ice Cube and Kimberly Woodruff

Ice Cube might be considered an old-school rapper, but his love life is anything but outdated. With a career spanning over three decades in both music and film, his relationship with his wife Kimberly Woodruff has stood the test of time.

Their love story began in 1988, and although their first encounter didn't spark a connection, fate intervened, giving Ice Cube a second chance to win her over six months later. Since tying the knot all those decades ago, their family has grown with the addition of four wonderful children. This enduring love story serves as an inspiration, proving that lasting relationships are possible, even in the fast-paced world of entertainment.

Usher and Jenn Goicoechea

Usher is a multi-talented American singer, songwriter, and dancer. He is known for his smooth R&B vocals and has won numerous awards, including eight Grammy Awards. Usher has been in the public eye for many years, and in 2019, he announced his engagement to Jenn Goicoechea.

Jenn Goicoechea is a music executive and lawyer, and she and Usher have been together for a few years. They welcomed their first child, a daughter named Sovereign Bo, in September 2020. Since then, Usher has been open about how fatherhood has changed his life and inspired his music. They welcomed their second child in 2021.

Justin Bieber and Hayley Baldwin

Hayley Baldwin and Justin Bieber have had quite a journey. They first crossed paths during their teenage years in 2009, but it wasn't until 2011 that sparks really flew between them. After a brief romance from 2015 to 2016, they split up and Justin rekindled his relationship with ex-girlfriend Selena Gomez.

However, nothing could keep these lovebirds apart, as just two years later, in 2018, Hayley and Justin were back together. It took no time before engagement bells started ringing as Justin proposed just months after getting back together; and not long after, in 2019, they tied the knot. Now happily wed with plans for children on the horizon, this is one hip-hop love story that seems to be the real thing.

Kid Ink and Asiah

It's a true high school sweetheart story for Kid Ink and Asiah Azante, who have been going strong for over a decade! The rapper and his leading lady exchanged vows in 2016 and welcomed their first child together shortly after.

Their relationship has weathered the ups and downs of the music industry, and Kid Ink has often credited Asiah for her unwavering support in both his personal and professional life. With such a strong bond between them, it's clear that these two are in it for the long haul — proving that sometimes the sweetest love stories can be found in the hallways of high school!

Queen Latifah and Eboni Nichols

Queen Latifah, whose real name is Dana Owens, is an American rapper, actress, and singer who has won numerous awards and accolades throughout her career. She has been capturing audiences with her performances on screen since the 90s. As for love, this leading lady has been in a long-term relationship with choreographer Eboni Nichols since 2013.

The couple has largely kept their relationship private, but they were spotted together at a 2019 event, where Nichols was seen wearing what appeared to be an engagement ring. While they have not publicly confirmed their engagement or any plans to marry, they welcomed a baby together in 2019.

Black Thought and Michelle Trotter

Black Thought, whose real name is Tariq Luqmaan Trotter, is a rapper, singer, and songwriter best known for being the lead MC of the hip-hop group The Roots. In 2010, he married Michelle Trotter, a professional chef and restaurateur. Tariq and Michelle have been together for more than a decade and even had two kids together.

Black Thought has often spoken about his love for Michelle and how she has been a constant source of support throughout his career. In a 2017 interview with Rolling Stone, he said, "She's always been there for me, and I've always been there for her. We've grown together, and that's a beautiful thing."

Bow Wow and Erica Mena

How could we ever forget the incredible Lil Bow Wow? Originally going under the wing of Snoop Dogg, this child rapper grew up into a pretty serious deal, and has managed to stay relevant, appearing on TV shows and films here and there.

Shad Moss, the man better known these days as just Bow Wow, actually had a pretty rocky relationship with TV personality Erica Mena at one point. They had plenty of breakups and public fights over the years. Ultimately, the couple decided to call off their engagement and are just friends these days. Bow Wow also had a daughter with Joie Chavis.

Paul Wall and Crystal

Paul Wall, the Houston-based rapper, has been married to his longtime love Crystal Slayton for over 10 years! The couple met when they were in high school and reconnected years later when Paul was already an established rapper. Crystal has been his rock throughout his music career, even managing his merchandise and touring with him.

They tied the knot in 2006 and have since welcomed two children into their family. The couple has been through some tough times, including a home invasion in which Paul was injured, but they have managed to overcome the obstacles together and communicate through every step of the way.

Kurupt and Gail Gotti

Ricardo Emmanuel Brown, better known by his stage name Kurupt, is an American rapper and actor hailing from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He first gained prominence in the 1990s as a member of the hip-hop group Tha Dogg Pound alongside Snoop Dogg and Daz Dillinger. With a career spanning over three decades, Kurupt has released several successful albums and collaborated with numerous prominent artists.

He was also once in a relationship with Gail Gotti, who is also a talented rapper and songwriter. The former couple got together and tied the knot back in 2007 and seemed to have an unbreakable bond. Ultimately, they decided to call it quits ten years later.

Lil Wayne and Denise Bidot

Lil Wayne has been off the market since 2020, and it's all thanks to his model girlfriend, Denise Bidot. The two have been playing a game of "are they, aren't they" on social media, with snaps of them cozying up together. But when Lil Wayne endorsed Donald Trump for the US presidential election in 2020, it caused a stir in their relationship.

Luckily, the couple seems to have reconciled and is going strong. They even attended the Super Bowl together, making it clear that they're still very much a couple. It's always great to see love win, and we hope Lil Wayne and Denise Bidot continue to make sweet music together.

Big Daddy Kane and Shawnette Hardy

Antonio Hardy, better known as Big Daddy Kane, is an American rapper, songwriter, and actor who rose to fame in the late 1980s with his unique style of rhyming and commanding stage presence. Born in Brooklyn, New York, Big Daddy Kane is often revered as one of the most influential and skilled rappers in the history of hip-hop.

This legend has been married to Shawnette Hardy since 2010, having been together for over two decades. Hardy, a music management professional, has played a significant role in her husband's career, and together they have two children. Despite facing challenges in their personal lives, they have managed to maintain a strong bond and continue to inspire many with their unwavering commitment to each other.

Travis Scott and Kylie Jenner

Travis Scott's career skyrocketed in 2015 with the release of his hit single "Antidote," and along with fame came the inevitable romantic entanglements. Enter Kylie Jenner, the media personality and business mogul who captured Travis's heart. Though their relationship has faced its share of scandals and rumors, Travis and Kylie continue to stand strong together.

They first publicly confirmed their romance at Coachella in 2017, and since then, their family has grown. Now, they are the proud parents of two beautiful children — Stormi Webster and a son who was renamed Aire after the parents changed their minds about the original Wolf Jacques. Their relationship, marked by resilience and love, demonstrates that even in the face of adversity, a strong bond can prevail.

Donald Glover and Michelle White

While much of Donald Glover's personal life remains a mystery, it's been reported that he and Michelle White have been together since their days at New York University. Their relationship has stood the test of time, with White standing by Childish Gambino's side throughout his rise to fame as an actor, comedian, director, and musician.

In addition to their three children, the couple has also collaborated professionally, with White serving as a writer on Glover's hit FX series "Atlanta." It's inspiring to see two talented individuals support each other in both their personal and professional lives. Not something we see every day.

Erykah Badu and JaRon Adkison

Erykah Badu introduced her new partner, musician JaRon Adkison, to the world via Instagram in December 2021. Adkison, who goes by JaRon the Secret, is a musician from Dallas, Texas. He is a multi-talented artist who works as a music producer, audio engineer, artist, songwriter, and author.

The couple was seen enjoying each other's company in nature and at home in candid photos shared by Badu. They were even seen wearing matching untraditional rings on their ring fingers, which led to speculation that they might be getting married. Although conventional ceremonies or labels don’t seem like something that Badu pays very much attention to at all.

Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith

Will Smith is undoubtedly one of the most beloved entertainers of our generation, and he first made his mark on the world as a rapper with hits like “Men in Black.” Jada Pinkett-Smith has stood by his side through thick and thin for years.

While rumors swirled at the Oscars that all was not well between them, Will and Jada remain devoted to each other after two decades together and raising two children. Their enduring love story shows just how strong their bond truly is, even in the face of tabloid speculation. And even if they did end up opting for separation, we imagine it would be as amicable and supportive as possible.

Offset and Cardi B

The two rappers first started dating in 2017 and secretly tied the knot the same year. Offset later publicly proposed to Cardi during a concert! Things got rocky when Offset was caught with someone else. They split up in 2018, but not for long, as Offset crashed Cardi's performance to try and win her back.

The couple reconciled but then hit another bump in the road when Cardi filed for divorce in 2020. The two were spotted getting cozy again and eventually called off the divorce. They now have a daughter and seem to be going strong. These two really are one of the kings and queens of rap.

Machine Gun Kelly and Megan Fox

When Machine Gun Kelly and Megan Fox first locked eyes on the set of “Midnight in the Switchgrass,” it was like fireworks went off, and who could blame them? Even though she was fresh out of marriage, their chemistry was undeniable.

Fast forward two years, and this rapper-actress duo is a Hollywood power couple, making appearances on red carpets around the world. However, not long after announcing their much-anticipated engagement, Megan broke it off. But as fate would have it, they’ve recently been seen together traipsing around the city and going to nightclubs, so who knows, maybe the wedding is back on track? One can only hope.

Wiz Khalifa and Aimee Aguilar

Wiz Khalifa and Aimee Aguilar’s relationship has been the talk of the town since they were first seen together. While Wiz has been making a name for himself in the music industry, Aimee is also making strides in her career as a fashion model and aspiring actress. Needless to say, this is one cool couple.

The couple has been low-key about their relationship, but their chemistry is undeniable. They were spotted enjoying a cozy dinner in downtown L.A. in December. Since then, rumors have been swirling about the possibility of Aimee joining Wiz on his journey toward Hollywood stardom.

Halle Bailey and DDG

Halle Bailey, a rising star in the music industry, has skillfully kept her love life under wraps, leaving her fans eager for any tidbits of information. That is until she was spotted with DDG, an event that sent ripples through the internet and had fans buzzing with excitement.

Rather than fueling the speculation, the couple maintained their privacy, keeping their relationship status a secret for some time. Eventually, they confirmed their romance on social media, and the response was nothing short of ecstatic. Fans couldn't help but be captivated by this adorable pair, whose undeniable chemistry makes them the talk of the town. Halle Bailey and DDG have managed to balance their personal lives with their public personas.

Jeezy and Jeanie Mai

Jeezy and Jeanie Mai tied the knot in March 2021 after a whirlwind romance. The couple's love story started at Jeanie's talk show, The Real, where they met in 2018, and they kept their relationship under wraps until they were spotted together at the SnoBall Gala in Atlanta in August 2019.

After a year of dating, Jeezy proposed to Mai in April 2020. Despite the pandemic canceling their planned trip to Vietnam, the rapper found a way to bring the country to them, and they are now happily married and proud parents to their little bundle of joy. So adorable.

Xzibit and Krista Joiner

Xzibit is an American rapper, actor, and TV host with an impressive career in the entertainment industry. He's known for his hit songs like "X" and "Paparazzi," as well as his role in the hit TV show "Pimp My Ride." But when it comes to his personal life, Xzibit was all about his wife Krista Joiner.

The two tied the knot in 2014 and, at one point, were almost always seen together on red carpets and industry events. With her own successful career as a fitness model and trainer, Krista was the perfect match for Xzibit's swag and style before separating in 2021.

Ludacris and Eudoxie Mbouguiengue

Ludacris has had a wild ride in the entertainment industry for more than two decades, but when it comes to his love life, he has been able to find his one and only. Eudoxie Mbouguiengue is the woman who won Ludacris's heart and has been his wife for since the year 2014.

After five years of dating, Ludacris proposed to Eudoxie in Costa Rica in 2014, and they decided to get married on the same day. Even after facing a scandal, which could have rocked their relationship, the couple decided to stick together and make it work. They have welcomed two children together and are still going strong.

Pusha T and Virginia Williams

Pusha T's love story with Virginia Williams reads like a fairytale, with the "Hell Hath No Fury" rapper falling for her across the room at his album release party. After getting to know each other, the duo decided to take the plunge and exchange vows in 2018 in a glamorous ceremony at Virginia Beach's Cavalier Hotel.

Their wedding was attended by several A-listers, including Pharrell Williams, Kanye West, and Kim Kardashian. Two years later, their happiness multiplied with the birth of their first child, Nigel Brixx Thornton. It seems like Pusha T and Virginia Williams' love story is nothing short of a chart-topping hit.

Mr. Papers and Lil Kim

It's been a rocky road for Mr. Papers and Lil Kim, who have had an on-again, off-again relationship for the past decade. They first started dating in 2012 and even welcomed a daughter, Royal Reign, in 2014 before calling it quits in 2015.

After a tumultuous custody battle over their daughter, the couple finally found a way to work things out and rekindled their love in 2020. It just goes to show that sometimes love can find its way back, even after years of ups and downs. Here's to hoping Mr. Papers and Lil Kim can make it work this time around!

Young Thug and Mariah the Scientist

American rapper, singer, and songwriter Young Thug is known for his unique style and impressive beats. He's collaborated with some of the biggest names in music and has become one of the most respected and successful rappers in the game. As for his personal life, Young Thug is devoted to his partner Mariah the Scientist.

With her own impressive career as an R&B singer/songwriter, Mariah seems to be the perfect match for Young Thug's unique personality. The two are often seen together at red carpet events, bringing some amazing style to the table. Together, they're a force to be reckoned with both on and off the stage.

Big Sean and Jhene Aiko

For a decade, Big Sean and Jhené Aiko shared an unbreakable bond of friendship. Little did they know, something more profound was waiting to bloom. Their journey began as close pals in 2012, and after enjoying half a decade of camaraderie, they decided to take the leap and explore romantic love.

The couple chose to keep their newfound passion a secret, savoring the intimacy and joy of their blossoming relationship. However, in 2018, the rumor mill went into overdrive, with fans and media buzzing about their suspected romance. Amid the frenzy, Big Sean took to social media to confirm what everyone had been speculating: their love was real, and it was here to stay.

Chrissy Lampkin and Jim Jones

Chrissy Lampkin and Jim Jones have been in a long-term relationship since the early 2000s. They first met when Chrissy was working as a stylist for Jim's music videos, and since then, they've been inseparable. Their relationship was documented on the reality TV show “Love & Hip Hop,” which propelled them into the spotlight and made us fans love them even more.

While they are not yet married, the couple has been engaged since 2011 and has expressed their desire to tie the knot in the future. Their love story is a testament to the power of perseverance and dedication in a relationship.

Wyclef Jean and Marie Claudinette

Wyclef Jean and Marie Claudinette are more than just a power couple in the music industry. They have been happily married for over 20 years. Despite facing some early challenges in their relationship, including rumors of infidelity, they managed to overcome them and founded the Yéle Haiti Foundation together, helping the Haitian people.

In 2009, Wyclef and Marie welcomed a new addition to their family — Angelina Claudinelle Jean, whom they lovingly adopted. The couple has always been open about their adoption journey and proudly appeared in public with their daughter. Now that is a true love story if we ever saw one.

IceWear Vezzo and Kiara Marie

Born Chivez Smith, IceWear Vezzo started his music career in 2012 and has since released several albums and mixtapes. His music often revolves around his life experiences and the struggles of growing up in the streets. In recent years, he has been making headlines not just for his music, but also for his love story with wife Kiara Marie.

These lovebirds met in high school and were together for years before finally tying the knot in 2016. They’ve been together ever since and support each other both personally and professionally with IceWear Vezzo often crediting Kiara for his music's success.

Slick Rick and Mandy Aragones

Slick Rick, the legendary English-American rapper and record producer, took the music industry by storm in the mid-1980s with his group Doug E Fresh & The Get Fresh Crew. His beautiful wife Mandy Aragones, whom he met at a Manhattan nightclub in the 90s, has been along for the ride every step of the way.

The lovebirds married in 1997 and since then have had two wonderful kids: Lateisha and Ricky. Although not much is known about Mrs Aragones, as she chooses to stay out of public view, one thing's certain: This is one hip-hop celebrity couple that has stayed strong for over two decades.

2 Chainz and Kesha Ward

When 2 Chainz proposed to Kesha Ward not once but twice, it was like hitting the jackpot in love! The first time he popped the question was at the BET Awards in 2013, but their busy schedules didn't allow for a wedding. Fast forward five years, and the rapper stunned Kesha and fans alike when he proposed again at the prestigious Met Gala.

The couple tied the knot on August 18, 2018, in a lavish wedding ceremony. It seems like when it comes to Kesha, 2 Chainz is all in — twice the love, twice the proposal, twice the luck!

Nardo Wick and Soryiaa

Nardo Wick is a rising star in the American rap scene, known for his unique style and smooth flow. He first made waves with his hit song "Who Want Smoke?" and has since released several successful singles and collaborations. But it's not just his music that's catching attention — Nardo's relationship with his girlfriend Soryiaa is also turning heads.

The two are often seen together on social media, sharing playful banter and adorable moments. We wonder if marriage is on the cards for these young lovers, although it’s probably too soon to tell, since they’ve only been dating for a short period of time. With her own impressive following on Instagram, Soryiaa is clearly Nardo's biggest fan and supporter. Looks like Nardo found his perfect match both on and off the mic.

Lil Baby and Jayda Cheaves

Lil Baby started his music career in 2017 and quickly gained a following with his debut mixtape, "Perfect Timing." He continued to release hit songs such as "My Dawg" and "Freestyle," which helped establish him as one of the top hip-hop artists in the game.

As for his love life, Lil Baby has been in a long-term relationship with Jayda Cheaves since 2016. Jayda is a social media influencer and entrepreneur who has been supportive of Lil Baby's career, often attending his shows and events. Together, they have a son named Loyal and have been open about their struggles as a couple, including difficult rumors and public arguments.

Lil Scrappy and Bambi Benson

Lil Scrappy and Bambi Benson's relationship has been nothing short of a rollercoaster ride. The “Love and Hip-Hop: Atlanta” stars first crossed paths at a club. Sparks flew, and they eventually became an item. But as we all know, love doesn't always go as planned, and the couple split in 2017, leaving fans stunned and disappointed.

Luckily, Scrappy and Bambi worked out their differences and tied the knot that same year. And the happy couple didn't stop there! They welcomed not one, not two, but three kids into the world, proving that their love can weather any storm. Good for them!

A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie and Ella "Bands" Rodriguez

A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie, born Artist Dubose, is a famous rapper from the Bronx, New York. He gained mainstream recognition with his debut album, "The Bigger Artist," which included hit singles "Drowning" and "Say A." He further rose to fame by collaborating with other notable artists, such as Cardi B and 6ix9ine.

His love life has been nothing short of a soap opera drama. A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie and longtime girlfriend Ella "Bands" Rodriguez have been putting on a show of love-and-hate since 2016, with social media serving as their stage. Ella is also involved in the music industry. Unfortunately, after a lot of drama and two kids later, they decided to call it quits in 2021.

Rev Run and Justine Jones

Rev Run, the iconic DJ and rapper who has blessed us with decades of music, tied the knot in '94 with his soulmate Justine Jones. Rev Run had three kids from his previous marriage and went on to have two more with his Justine. Tragically, however, one of them passed away soon after she was born, so the couple decided to adopt a baby girl.

As if that weren’t inspiring enough, both Rev Run and Justine have seen incredible success in their own rights. From Reverend Run becoming an actor and ordained minister (yes you read that right!), to Justine launching her own line of jewelry as well as having acting credits on some popular shows, these two have become a respected power couple.

Nicki Minaj and Kenneth Petty

Nicki Minaj may be known for her chart-topping hits and glamorous lifestyle, but it's her love life that has really caught our attention. Amongst all her celebrity romances, there's one that stands out — the epic reunion with her high school flame, Kenneth Petty.

After years of being apart and a few entanglements in between, these two lovebirds were finally able to find their way back to each other! Their love story began when they were just 14 years old, and fate brought them together again after breakups with other partners. Now, they are happily married and proud parents of a beautiful baby boy.

Tyga and Avril Lavigne

In what many consider to be quite an odd match, the emo queen Avril Lavigne and famous rapper Tyga recently became a couple. The Canadian singer that rose to fame at age 16 with her chart-topping debut album “Let Go” is still a prominent figure in the music industry – and now one-half of a power couple.

Even though there had been rumors, Lavigne and Tyga confirmed them by sharing a passionate kiss in 2023 at a party thrown for actress Hunter Schafer by the fashion brand Mugler at Paris Fashion Week. We hope ex-wife Blac Chyna has no hard feelings about it all.

Timbaland and Monique Idlett

Famous rapper, songwriter, and music producer Timbaland was born in Virginia in 1972; he started his career as a DJ and worked his way up to producing chart-topping hits for world-famous artists like Justin Timberlake, Aaliyah, and Missy Elliott. In 2008, he married his longtime sweetheart Monique Idlett, who is also an entrepreneur and music executive.

In fact, Monique oversaw doing PR for the rapper for five years until it turned into a love story, and two years later, they tied the knot. Monique is now the CEO of her own tech venture capital firm and works alongside Timbaland on several projects. Despite hardships, this couple has stayed strong and have a beautiful daughter together.

Nicole Young and Dr. Dre

A true love story for the ages, the godfather of hip hop and one of the world’s most famous rappers, Dr. Dre, and his wife Nicole Young, were married for 24 years. Unfortunately, Nicole filed for divorce in 2020 due to alleged irreconcilable differences. While not together anymore, they are still worth a mention on this list since not only did they last for two decades, but were also one of the music industry’s fiercest power couples.

Their relationship had a rocky beginning since they met while Nicole was married to someone else – NBA celeb Sedale Threatt. Despite struggles with his career trajectory, family tragedies, and alleged extramarital adventures throughout their more than twenty years together, this super couple managed to stay strong for a long time.

Nas and Kelis

Widely regarded as one of the greatest rappers of all time, Nas also had one of the most highly publicized, tumultuous relationships in the world of rap. The man behind classic albums such as "Illmatic" heat things up with popular singer Kelis, tying the knot in 2005. Four years later, though, the latter filed for divorce, citing irreconcilable differences.

Despite having a kid together, this great news was marred by Nas facing accusations of domestic issues against Kelis. However, Nas vehemently denied such claims and even made an album addressing the entire relationship, called "Life Is Good," which received widespread critical acclaim.

Gucci Mane and Keyshia Ka'oir

Gucci was flipping through a magazine behind bars when he caught sight of his future love interest. Determined to meet her, the rapper asked his manager to book her for his next music video. Their connection couldn't be denied when they finally met face-to-face!

Unfortunately, fate forced them apart as Gucci soon returned to jail; but despite the long distance between them, they stayed strong throughout two years. Their efforts paid off when they got married on October 17, 2017, in a ceremony that aired on BET as "The Mane Event." The couple welcomed their son, Ice Davis, in 2020.

Ja Rule and Aisha Atkins

Ja Rule and Aisha Atkins' love story began when they wed in a distinctive 1940s-gangster-themed ceremony after high school graduation. Their unique bond has stood the test of time, navigating both highs and lows. In 2013, they confronted a damaging rumor about Ja Rule's alleged affair with a cellmate during his prison sentence for various legal issues.

Atkins, however, remained steadfast, supporting her husband through this challenging period. Now, they've celebrated over two decades of marriage and are proud parents to three beautiful children. Their enduring partnership demonstrates the power of true love, loyalty, and resilience in overcoming life's hurdles.

Fat Joe and Lorena Cartagena

Fat Joe, whose real name is Joseph Antonio Cartagena, is a renowned American rapper, actor, and podcast host. He began his music career in 1992 with his debut album “Represent”, and has since become a popular figure in the industry. His 2001 album, “Jealous Ones Still Envy (J.O.S.E.),” was his most successful album, selling over a million copies and getting certified Platinum.

As for his personal life, Joe has been married to his wife, Lorena Cartagena, since 1995. The couple, who were together for a long time before tying the knot, has two children together. They serve as an inspiration for many couples.

Pharrell Williams and Helen Lasichanh

Pharrell Williams and Helen Lasichanh have a beautiful love story that started as a friendship and eventually blossomed into a lifelong commitment. In 2008, Pharrell decided to take their friendship to the next level and they have been inseparable ever since.

Their love has only grown stronger over the years, and they decided to make it official by getting married. But that's not all — they are also proud parents to four incredible children, including triplets! It's clear that their love for each other and their family is unbreakable, and their story is an inspiration to us all. Seems Pharrell is truly “happy.”

Jay-Z and Beyonce

Jay-Z and Beyoncé's epic love story has captivated the music world over the last few decades. Meeting on a flight to Cancun for the 2000 MTV Spring Break festival, they felt an immediate spark. However, they nurtured their friendship for a year before exploring romance.

As a power couple, their bond extends beyond personal life, collaborating on numerous music projects. They exchanged vows in an intimate ceremony on April 4, 2008, and continue to thrive, raising three beautiful children. Jay-Z and Beyoncé's lasting love, rooted in friendship and creative partnership, inspires fans and artists alike, showcasing the strength of commitment and collaboration.

Lil Uzi Vert and JT

Lil Uzi Vert is a very successful American rapper known for his unique style and catchy beats. He's collaborated with some of the biggest names in hip-hop, and his songs have become anthems for a whole generation. But let's not forget about his talented girl — the fierce rapper and songwriter Jatavia Johnson, better known as JT, and half of the famous hip-hop duo ‘City Girls.’

Together, Lil Uzi Vert and JT make one of the most dynamic couples in today’s rap world. They're both at the top of their game, and their relationship is a testament to the power of passion and creativity. Whether they're spitting rhymes or making hits, Lil Uzi Vert and JT are always in sync.

T.I. and Tiny

The phrase "opposites attract" seems tailor-made for Tameka "Tiny" Cottle and T.I. When they first met, Tiny was the more prominent star, but she soon discovered that T.I. was destined to be her lifelong love. Though their journey together, they have encountered its fair share of challenges, but their relationship has only grown stronger through adversity.

The resilience they've demonstrated as a couple is both inspiring and heartwarming. And it's undeniable that they make a striking pair – Tiny's captivating beauty combined with T.I.'s irresistible charm creates a powerful and magnetic connection. So love can flourish even when two people seem remarkably different.

Stormzy and Maya Jama

British rapper Stormzy is arguably the most popular MC to come out of the United Kingdom in the last decade. And it's not just his career that the Londoner has been successful in over the years. In 2015, Stormzy had a pretty high-profile relationship with reality TV star Maya Jama.

During their time together, they appeared on the red carpet many times, and shared some heartwarming photos of them together on social media too. However, they announced their separation in 2019, as their busy schedules got in the way of their love. Despite their split, the two have remained friends.

Future and Ciara

At one point, Future and Ciara were one of the true power couples in all of hip-hop. For a minute there, the man born Nayvadius DeMun Wilburn was the hottest thing in the rap game, with hit songs such as "Mask Off" and "Life Is Good" to his name.

And then there is Ciara, who had her fair share of fame back in the naughties with hit songs such as "1, 2 Step." The couple had all the makings of a perfect dynamic duo and even got in engaged in October 2013. They even had a son together. However, after rumors surfaced of Future's infidelity, Ciara decided to call things off and move on.

Common and Tiffany Haddish

Common and Tiffany Haddish are a couple that knows how to have fun. And we can imagine that being with a talented comedienne like Haddish makes Common stay on top of his game. He’s already on top of his music game, being one of America’s most successful rappers since his debut album “Can I Borrow a Dollar?” in 1992.

Tiffany Haddish has seen immense success as an actress and comedienne and is a very accomplished woman in her own right. In a 2020 interview, Tiffany explained why the rapper is such a great match for her: "We laugh together AND we can have really deep conversations," she said. However, they decided to call it quits in 2021 due to personal differences.

Waka Flocka Flame and Tammy Rivera

Lovebirds Waka Flocka Flame and Tammy Rivera have been together for six years, despite experiencing some bumps in the road. The hip-hop couple got an up-close look at their relationship on hit reality shows like "Love & Hip Hop: Atlanta," as well as a more intense dive into marriage counseling when they appeared on “Marriage Bootcamp: Hip Hop Edition.”

Despite serious trust issues and an extramarital period, these two remain committed to making their marriage work. In fact, they renewed their vows in 2019, while celebrating five years of marriage. With heartwarming words that had everyone at the ceremony tearing up, Tammy said her vows, "I am marrying my best friend and soulmate all over again.”

LL Cool J and Simone Smith

LL Cool J and Simone Smith's love story began in the '80s when mutual friends introduced them. After eight years of dating, they married in 1995, and their relationship has been thriving since then. When Simone faced a bone cancer diagnosis, LL Cool J provided unwavering support, helping her through her recovery.

This challenge inspired Simone to create her own jewelry line, becoming a successful entrepreneur. The couple raised four children together and recently welcomed their adorable grandson, King James. Their love story demonstrates the power of commitment, resilience, and support in overcoming adversity, offering inspiration to couples all around the world.

Ice-T and Coco Austin

Ice-T and Coco Austin's love story is a remarkable tale of romance and commitment. The couple first met on the set of a music video and decided to get married within months in 2002. Their secret to a long-lasting marriage is open communication, and they reaffirmed their love by renewing their vows in a star-studded Hollywood ceremony in 2011.

Throughout their years together, Coco has faced several controversies, but Ice-T has consistently stood by her side, defending her in public. After all those years of marriage, the couple has one daughter, Chanel. Their unwavering love and devotion to their marriage continue to inspire fans and serve as an example of a strong and enduring relationship.

G Herbo and Taina Williams

G Herbo may be living the fast-paced life of a rapper, but one constant in his world is his lovely girlfriend, Taina Williams. They may keep their relationship under wraps, but every now and then they'll give fans a peek into their love story on social media.

Since 2019, the media has been buzzing about this power couple, and it's no surprise given the adorable things G Herbo shares about Taina. His Instagram account is covered with loving photos of her and them together. These two are clearly head-over-heels for each other and we can't wait to see what the future holds for them!

Snoop Dogg and Shante Broadus

Not only is Shante Broadus Snoop Dogg's significant other, but she's also his partner in the realm of business. Since they were high school sweethearts, Shante has been assisting Snoop when it comes to managing both his music deals and contracts. They started their relationship on the hush-hush. Eventually, though, they grew much closer and made things official.

Before tying the knot in 1997, the couple welcomed two kids into the world. The pair's relationship hit a rocky road when Snoop filed for divorce in 2004. Eventually, though, the pair found their way back to each other and remarried in 2008. Overall, Snoop and Shante have been married for much longer than is common in the entertainment industry and have had four kids.
